name: places/ChIJhesNT51ZwokRH7eUEIxIqNc
formattedAddress: 130 E 7th St floor 2, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 130 E 7th St floor 2, New York, NY 10009-6173, USA

originalText.text:
Great and accessible reformer Pilates studio in East Village! Each group class accommodates up to 8 students on the reformer machine (without the tower).

It can be a little confusing to find the studio, but the entrance is on East 7th Street. You have to ring for Avea and they’ll buzz you in. Walk up to the second floor!

They used to have large windows and a beautiful view but they’re going through some construction, so no views as of Oct 2023.

I’ve taken 20+ classes and my favorite instructor is Victoria, because she explains each movement and pushes us. I am so sore the next day.

Most of the students in the group classes are beginner or intermediate level. I’d say the typical crowd is a 20 or 30 something year old woman who wears a Target sports bra and has gone to 2-20 Pilates classes.

originalText.text: Beautiful studio, great teachers - Alec is my favorite. He is so precise, organized, and attentive. I always feel like I have had a thorough workout after his classes and he is so lovely

text.text: Beautiful studio, great teachers - Alec is my favorite. He is so precise, organized, and attentive. I always feel like I have had a thorough workout after his classes and he is so lovely

originalText.text: I’ve been a client at Avea for almost a year.  I am impressed with every aspect of Avea. All three studios are beautiful, and each instructor takes the time to get to know the individual student.  As a result, the instructors help nurture your growth and remember what you’re working on and/or any injuries you have from class to class.  One of my favorite instructors is Cassie, who pushes each student to reach their full potential, without asking anyone to do anything that makes them feel uncomfortable or unsafe. Erica L is incredibly gentle yet tough, and provides a real mental escape during the class. Alaina is another tough instructor but one who brings a lot of mindfulness and a beautiful energy to her classes. Overall, every instructor has a unique and special teaching style.  The other class attendees bring a positive, warm energy and friendly attitude.  Carrie (the owner) has cultivated a beautiful, welcoming space.  It is a very non-judgmental environment.  As a woman in her early 50s, I have felt so supported and encouraged and the instructors at Avea have helped me already lose 25 lbs. in preparation for my wedding!

Overall, every instructor has a unique and special teaching style.  The other class attendees bring a positive, warm energy and friendly attitude.  Carrie (the owner) has cultivated a beautiful, welcoming space.  It is a very non-judgmental environment.  As a woman in her early 50s, I have felt so supported and encouraged and the instructors at Avea have helped me already lose 25 lbs. in preparation for my wedding!

originalText.text: Took a class with Cassie a few days ago. She has a good tempo and pace but the exercises were fairly advanced and very difficult (impossible?) for a beginner/intermediate like me. Technically, this was a mixed-level class and all levels should be made to feel included. Yet, what puzzled me is that she didn't offer any suggestions for modifications: she just looked at me struggle and try to modify the exercises by myself, doing my best to get through the class. If you are a beginner, I would recommend another instructor.

originalText.text: Ave A is my absolute favorite Pilates studio. Carrie is a phenomenal instructor- she is so knowledgeable and always asks what each student wants to focus on at the beginning of class. Since there are only 5 reformer machines, it feels very intimate like a private class and you get proper adjustments throughout which is amazing. The studio is so pretty, great light and a view of the park. I’d highly recommend anyone to try Ave A Pilates from beginners to advanced.
